plptool

Class PLPSimBusModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • plptool.PLPSimBusModule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BusMonitor, Button, DummyMemory, FTracer, GPIO, InterruptController, LEDArray, MemModule, PLPID, SevenSegments, SimCoreConnector, Switches, Timer, UART, VGA

    public abstract class PLPSimBusModule
extends java.lang.Thread
    This is an abstract for a general purpose module that can be attached to the front-side bus. Registers for the module are implemented using TreeMap. This class provides all the necessary functions to implement a PLP simulator bus module, such as read and write functions, and address space management and error checking. The module then can be extended by implementing eval() and gui_eval() functions, effectively tying the module to the simulation core.
    See Also:
    PLPSimBus

    • Field Detail

      • threaded

        public boolean threaded
        Denotes whether this module should run on its own thread. Defaults to false.

      • stop

        public boolean stop

      • values

        protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Object> values
        Registers for the module

      • isInstr

        protected java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Boolean> isInstr
        Denotes each entry in the register whether it is an instruction. Useful for main memory implementations or caches.

      • wordAligned

        protected boolean wordAligned
        Denotes whether the registers are addressed in memory-aligned fashion.

      • startAddr

        protected long startAddr
        Starting address of the address space

      • endAddr

        protected long endAddr
        Final address of the address space (inclusive)

      • enabled

        protected boolean enabled
        Write-enable and whether evaluations are enabled, but subclasses can choose to ignore this

      • phantom

        public boolean phantom
        This variable tells the bus whether it actually stores data in the mapped region. Defaults to false. Useful for modules that need to see bus accesses but do not require registers (cache simulators, snoopers, etc)

      • PLPSimBusModule

                       long endAddr,
                       boolean wordAligned)
        The constructor for the superclass requires the address space and whether the registers of the module are word-aligned
        Parameters:
        startAddr - Starting address of the module's address space
        endAddr - End address of the module's address space
        wordAligned - Whether the module's address space is word aligned

        Empty/nullary constructor for dynamic module loading

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public java.lang.String getVersion()
        PLPSimBusModule defaults to returning the current version of PLPTool. User modules can override this. May be useful for dynamic modules
        Returns:
        String of PLPTool version

      • writeReg

        public final int writeReg(long addr,
                          java.lang.Object data,
                          boolean isInstr)
        Write data to one of the module's registers. Only possible when the module is enabled. The write command is ignored otherwise.
        Parameters:
        addr - Address to write to
        data - Data to be written
        isInstr - Denotes whether the value to be written is an instruction
        Returns:
        PLP_OK, or error code

      • readReg

        public final java.lang.Object readReg(long addr)
        Read one of the module's registers
        Parameters:
        addr - Address to read from
        Returns:
        Data, or PLP_ERROR_RETURN

      • write

        public int write(long addr,
                 java.lang.Object data,
                 boolean isInstr)
        Wrapper function for writeReg. Developers may wish to override this function to implement module-specific write actions without sacrificing PLPSimBusModule original writeReg functionality. This is the actual function that will be called by PLPSimBus.
        Parameters:
        addr - Address to write to
        data - Data to be written
        isInstr - Denotes whether the value to be written is an instruction
        Returns:
        PLP_OK, or error code

      • read

        public java.lang.Object read(long addr)
        Wrapper function for readReg. Developers may wish to override this function to implement module-specific read actions without sacrificing PLPSimBusModule original readReg functionality. This is the actual function that will be called by PLPSimBus.
        Parameters:
        addr - Address to read from
        Returns:
        Data, or PLP_ERROR_RETURN

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Reinitialize the module's registers

      • getValueSet

        public java.lang.Object[][] getValueSet()
        This method can be useful to modules that have to walk through the whole register file on evaluation.
        Returns:
        n x 3 Object array containing addresses, values of the memory module and boolean denoting whether the value is instruction or not.

                             long endAddr,

        endAddr - End address of the module's address space
        wordAligned - Whether the module's address space is word aligned

      • eval

        public abstract int eval()
        The eval() function represents the behavior of the module itself. For example, an eval function for an array of LED will read its register and light up proper LEDs. Simulation cores will call this function every cycle, so this may slow down the simulation considerably.
        Returns:
        Status code.

      • gui_eval

        public abstract int gui_eval(java.lang.Object x)
        gui_eval is designed for simulator developers / users to allow the module to interact with the simulation environment directly. This function is only called every time the GUI components are refreshed. Simulation cores do not/should not call this function every cycle.
        Parameters:
        x - Reference to a frame object that this module will interact with.
        Returns:
        Status code.

      • reset

        public abstract void reset()
        This method is called by PLPSimBus.reset(). It is up to the module on how this should be implemented.

      • introduce

        public abstract java.lang.String introduce()
        Introduction string when the module is loaded.
